intro: Tarenna funebris, commonly known as the black tarenna, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its dark, almost black, bark and its small, clustered flowers. Tarenna funebris typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
